alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Henry, southwestern Washington and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1027 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pleasant Plain, or 12 miles southwest of Washington, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Brighton around 1035 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Coppock and Washington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
